newsitem.title: USA: Duff & Phelps cuts rating on Circus debt.
newsitem.headline: Duff & Phelps cuts rating on Circus debt.

text.p: Duff & Phelps Credit Rating Co said Tuesday it downgraded its rating on Circus Circus Enterprise Inc's senior notes and debentures to Triple-B from Triple-B-Plus.
The firm also said it cut Circus' senior subordinated notes and debentures to Triple-B-Minus from Triple-B. The commercial paper rating of D-Two was reaffirmed.
About $900 million of outstanding debt securities are affected by the action, Duff & Phelps said.
Duff & Phelps said the action is attributable to debt-financed share repurchases in advance of capital expenditure plans for new developments.
Circus repurchased $340 mllion of its common stock during the second half of its fiscal year and invested more than $530 million to expand and maintain its property portfolio, Duff & Phelps said.
Duff & Phelps said, however, it expects Circus' investments will boost the company's leading position in Las Vegas.
